intro: Diplospora andamanensis, commonly known as the Andaman diplospora, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and waxy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Its reproductive structures are unique, featuring a specialized inflorescence that facilitates pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
